message: Guys anyone have tried this before?!
story: Alaa Attya Mohamed shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: HipChat
caption: hipchat.com
description: HipChat is hosted group chat and video chat built for teams. Supercharge real-time collaboration with persistent chat rooms, file sharing, and screen sharing.

data.message: There was an old post about collaboration tools, and HipChat was mentioned, but I can't remember who's the one who mentioned it :\
Hassan Aly Selim yup just found it :D https://www.facebook.com/groups/egyptian.geeks/permalink/768495073190203/
Yeah that's the one, I remember that Ahmed Kamal was in the conversation, but I wasn't sure if he's the one who mentioned HipChat :D
Amr Eldib i've tried slack and it's pretty awesome, so what are the key difference between them?!
and why did the team choose it over slack?!

Alaa Attya Mohamed if you search for a collabaration/messaging  tool for a team .. check 
https://kato.im »messaging» better than hip 
https://slack.com  brings all your communication together in one place
I used HipChat for two years, it is ok

I use it a lot at work. In general it's great, especially compared to #cough Lync. The Windows client is very unstable, but I use the web client (which is perfect) set as an application (Chrome menu:-> More Tools -> Create application shortcuts | allows you to run page in its own Window with no address bar etc, like an application, and create shortcuts on Desktop, Taskbar). The Android app is good too.
